programme.title: Did First Officer Murdoch Shoot Himself?
programme.desc: Did First Officer Murdoch Shoot Himself? The Cameron movie suggests he did, but Parks Stephenson provides us with an eyewitness testimony that states another end for Officer Murdoch.

programme.title: Masabumi Hosono
programme.desc: The only Japanese passenger on Titanic helped save lives, but was ostracized back in his home country for the rest of his life. There’s been many published accounts about Hosono, but now Robert Bracken gives us the real story.

programme.title: The Picture of a Dog in a Lifeboat
programme.desc: Senan Molony’s uncovered an unbelievable picture of a dog being rescued in one of Titanic’s lifeboats. Was it possible that dogs were actually allowed to board lifeboats?

programme.title: A Thief on Titanic
programme.desc: It’s always been a mystery why so many passengers on board Titanic were traveling incognito. Senan Molony uncovers the identity of one secret traveler, who ended up being a thief.

programme.title: Should The Lookouts Have Had Binoculars? - Parks Stephenson REV
programme.desc: Why didn’t the lookouts have binoculars? If they had, could the disaster have been avoided? This is always a big debate around Titanic circles. Parks Stephenson’s answers to these questions may surprise you.

programme.title: The Mirage Theory
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson gives us a clear and thorough explanation of the Mirage Theory. Does this theory really explain why Titanic hit the iceberg?

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: How Did Titanic Sink?
programme.desc: He’s visited the wreck more than 30 times in the last 25 years. P.H. Nargeolet gives us his personal observations about the wreck and how Titanic might have gone down.

programme.title: Submarine Signals
programme.desc: In 1912, the greatest threat to shipping was not ice - it was fog. Bill Sauder explains how submarine signaling helped navigate ships like Titanic through treacherous waters.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: The Padded Room
programme.desc: Hidden away in Titanic’s isolation hospital was a 5x6 room padded completely from top to bottom with canvas cushions. White Star didn’t talk much about the room, but Bill Sauder will tell you how it was used.

programme.title: An Experience of A Lifetime Diving Titanic
programme.desc: He was the first school teacher to dive Titanic, not once - but twice. In this very candid account, Titanic channel host Charles Haas tells us how nerves almost kept him from going. In the end, his journey to his beloved Titanic proved to be an exciting...

programme.title: Titanic's Most Refined Features
programme.desc: Titanic Historian Bill Sauder continues his look at Titanic’s remarkable First Class Lounge. In this episode, Sauder reveals the architectural and decorative point of view and shows why the room was a showcase onboard the ship.

programme.title: Another View on the Coal Burning Fire
programme.desc: A recent documentary presented new theories about the coal burning fire onboard Titanic. Parks Stephenson gives his view of the fire and how it affected Titanic. Senan Molony and Parks Stephenson, two of our hosts, are on Titanic’s center stage!

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained!

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might...

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: The Gimbal Lamp
programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Archibald Gracie’s Last Letter
programme.desc: Host Andrew Aldridge reveals a remarkable letter written by Archibald Gracie barely eight weeks before he died. It was written to fellow Carpathia passenger Louis Ogden, who was responsible for some of the iconic photographs taken of Titanic survivors...

programme.title: Rescuing the Telegrams
programme.desc: Charles Haas shares the remarkable story of how priceless pieces of Titanic history were rescued before they were almost lost forever from a dumpster in New York City.

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: The Last Remaining White Star Ship
programme.desc: Built next to its bigger sisters in the H&W shipyards SS Nomadic, Titanic and Olympic’s tender, gives us the only remaining glimpse into what it was like to be onboard the Titanic.

programme.title: Norvan Falls
programme.desc: A group of us pay a visit to one of our favourite local waterfalls, Norvan Falls in North Vancouver, BC. Youll also get a look at how the falls look when frozen mid-winter.

programme.title: Best Via Ferrata in the Julian Alps Eng
programme.desc: Just about an hours drive from Ljubljana airport, Prisojnik, or Prisank as its also called is a beautiful 2,547m mountain in Slovenias Julian Alps.This one-day via Ferrata route is a must-do since it presents an excellent hiking and climbing challenge, but also offers all of the views youd even want. To get to its summit Cris and Viv hiked, scrambled, climbed, and even crawled on their stomachs at points, but the views in the end and the feeling of satisfaction that came after made it all worthwhile.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2023 Ep4 Fieberbrunn, Austria
programme.desc: The Freeride World Tour 2023 has its fourth stop in Fieberbrunn, Austria - as always with the best freeriders from all over the world! The first part of the FWT finals takes place in Fieberbrunn, where the athletes have to conquer the imposing Wildseeloder. This mountain is a real test of endurance even for the most experienced pros, and the athletes will certainly have to give it all.

programme.title: World Rookie Freeski Finals 2024
programme.desc: The World Rookie Tour is excited that the Freeski Finals are held in the magnificent Ursus Snowpark at Madonna di Campiglio. This event shows the world’s most talented young freeski athletes as they compete in one of the most celebrated snowparks in Europe.This exclusive opportunity brings the excitement and competitive spirit of one of the most anticipated events in youth action sports directly to athletes, fans and viewers. Fans from across the globe have the opportunity to witness the future of freeskiing unfold in real-time.

programme.title: Engadin Ski Marathon 2023
programme.desc: On Sunday, March 12, 2023, more than 14,000 athletes competed in the 53rd edition of the Engadin Skimarathon, the second largest cross-country skiing event in the world and the largest cross-country skiing event in Switzerland. Among the large crowd of participants are also world-class runners. What awaits them on this day in the high valley are 42 strenuous kilometers over frozen lakes, past typical Engadine villages and through a picturesque Swiss Alpine landscape. The best completed the course in a time of around 1.5 hours.

programme.title: The Rise of the Hamminator Lindsey Hamm s journey from concrete to peaks
programme.desc: Mammut athlete Lindsey Hamm, a professional climber and mountain guide, brings a breath of fresh air to the world of mountaineering. Originally from Texas, she has begun making a name for herself in recent years. This short film offers a glimpse into her life, a recent expedition to Pakistan’s wild Charakusa Valley. Beyond the mountains, Lindsey is a people person, driven by a passion for inclusivity in climbing, and giving opportunities to other women, who want to get into the sport. She collaborates with womens organizations in Pakistan, helping to dismantle barriers and create opportunities for education and growth.

programme.title: Freeski World Rookie Fest Innsbruck 2024
programme.desc: Once again Nordkette Skyline Park hosts the next generation of Freeski to showcase the future of the sport. Riders hit the Slopestyle course above Innsbruck to determine who will get tickets for this year’s World Rookie Freeski Finals later on this season.

programme.title: Lekkarod 2022 (V. Int)
programme.desc: It is an exceptional line-up of mushers that has an appointment for this seventh edition of the Lekkarod. Coming from France, Germany, Switzerland, Spain and Alaska, 30 teams and 13 participants in the ski-joëring category took part in a total of 9 stages. From Chamrousse(Isère) to Bessans (Savoie) via Val DArly, the Lekkarod is an event counting for the IFSS World Cup (International Federation of Sleddog Sports).

programme.title: Freeride World Tour 2023 Rd3 Kicking Horse Golden BC, Canada
programme.desc: The Freeride World Tour continues in Canada at Kicking Horse Golden BC, (CAN). Known for its champagne powder and long, steep runs, it’s no wonder Kicking Horse attracts riders from all over the globe. The competition takes place on the ever-impressive Ozone Face, offering riders 324 meters of vertical drop and a varied freeride playground of steep terrain, cornices, transfers, and big cliffs. This provides something to suit the different styles of the athletes, who scope out their lines and aim for what could earn a podium finish. In the back of their minds is the cut, which means for many, this would be their last FWT event of the season, and so they have nothing to lose to stay on tour and earn their place in the FWT Finals.

programme.title: X-out Montenegro
programme.desc: X-out Montenegro is part of the Xtri World Tour. Athletes starts with a 1.7 km open-water course. The race is started by the Xekutioner, a formidable figure who will be responsible for future eliminations. 15 of athletes will be eliminated by the Xekutioner, intensifying the competition. Eliminated athletes are given a time penatly and can then try to catch “The Splitter” to ovetake backmarkers and get back in the race! Then a tough and demanding 40 km asphalt cycle which climbs the famous serpentine above Kotor. Designed to test endurance to the max. Another 15 of athletes are eliminated by the Xekutioner here, ensuring only the toughest stay. Finally 6.5 km of downhill trail running and 2.5 km of “vertical” monster climbing. Again eliminated athletes have the opportunity to catch the leaders.

programme.title: 2024 Morocco Marathon des Sables (Eng)
programme.desc: Organized in the same province as the MDS Legendary, the 3rd edition of the MDS Morocco offers a 120km course starting from Tafraout Sidi Ali! A massive bivouac has been set up to accommodate the 600 runners of the 2024 edition, including 10 disabled athletes teams, and it’s a world first! Accompanied by two runners, these athletes will participate in a 4-day trail, fully selfsufficient, just like all the other competitors! Another exciting surprise for this edition is the presence of Abdelkader El-Mouaziz, winner of NY Marathon 2000, alongside Rachid El Morabity!

programme.title: New Zealand 9
programme.desc: In a race against time, three adventurers will set a new speed record by completing New Zealand’s nine Great Walks faster than they’ve ever been done before, using human power alone. It’s the ultimate adventure race. They’ll kayak 145 km, ride 80 km and run over 300 km in just nine days.

programme.title: Adamello Ultra Trail 2024 - 170 km
programme.desc: The Adamello Ultra-Trail® is a trail running race of 170 km in length and about 11,500 m of elevation gain, to be covered in semi-self-sufficiency, organized by the ASD Adamello Ultra-Trail in collaboration with the Union of the Upper Camonica Valley Municipalities. The maximum time allowed to finish the race is 53 hours.

programme.title: An aggressive character
programme.desc: Do you have a sporting spirit? Then hop on this new Skipper BSK 34 NC. This version is the latest restyling of the NC 100S model, which in 2016 had won the Red Dot Award, a much sought-after international prize. On board, an important technical novelty… discover it with The Boat Show.

programme.title: A yacht with many secrets
programme.desc: Every time Maurizio steps on board a boat by De Antonio, he feels amazed by the constant progress made by the shipyard, from the style to the performance. This time is the turn of the De Antonio D50 Open, the flagship of the De Antonio range, and is a yacht that hides several secrets. Come find them out

programme.title: Barker Boatworks 40 HPC – FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show, on board the Barker Boatworks 40 HPC, an incredible catamaran designer by Michael Peters.

programme.title: VanDutch 32 - A powerful minimalism
programme.desc: The new VanDutch 32 is a cruiser with an extraordinary and unmistakable profile. The lines that characterize the products of VanDutch Yachts are essential and harmonious. Jump on board with The Boat Show!

programme.title: Extra X99 Fast On board a luxury yacht
programme.desc: The Boat Show is on board the new Extra X99 Fast, a luxury yacht that will let you experience the thrill of speed on the sea.

programme.title: A flawless configuration
programme.desc: Get on board the motor yacht Rizzardi INfive, a great yacht that is a pleasure to drive. It is sporty, fast, with a flawless classing configuration. 16 meters of excitement!

programme.title: Pearl 72 - Flibs 2022
programme.desc: Worldwide premier of the Pearl 72, discover this incredible flybridge with many areas where to relax. Exceptional seakeeping, designed to follow the success of its sistership.

programme.title: Pershing GTX 116 The seascape revolution
programme.desc: Are you ready to get a unique on-board experience with the brand-new performance yacht Pershing GTX 116? Follow Maurizio Bulleri as he walks through the speed yacht lovers’ potential suitor.

programme.title: Viking - Range - FLIBS 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett takes you to the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show to discover the Viking Yachts range.

programme.title: Academy - 24 to 40 meters superyachts
programme.desc: Our Maurizio Bulleri presents a selection of yachts from 24 to 40 meters, offering a complete overview of this marine sector. All the chosen yachts have been selected for their special features and as masterpieces of style, beauty and technique.

programme.title: Dyna 63 Fly – FLIBS 2022
programme.desc: The Boat Show is at the Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show 2022 with Bill Hackett and Brad Heil. Hop on board the Dyna 63 Fly.

programme.title: Tankoa Solo - A nautical masterpiece
programme.desc: The Boat Show offers you a special seat to discover magnificent vessels, inside and out. That’s the turn of the Tankoa Solo, a superyacht with a long story and was built with the only goal to be perfect in every way. Discover all the work behind this Italian masterpiece.

programme.title: Mangusta Oceano 44 Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Mangusta Oceano 44 is a masterpiece of elegance and innovation. Built in Italy by Overmarine, this three-deck superyacht stands out for its cutting-edge design, spacious interiors and extraordinary performance, redefining the concept of luxury on the open sea.

programme.title: Heesen Yachts Palm Beach International Boat Show 2024
programme.desc: Maria Elisa Altese presents Book Ends, the 50 meter superyacht by Heesen Yachts. The strengths of this vessel include exceptional performance, magnificent design and the shipyards cutting-edge innovation for eco-sustainable advancement.

programme.title: Sunseeker Superhawk 55 - A famous line
programme.desc: Get ready for the review of the new Sunseeker Superhawk 55 and discover it with Maurizio Bulleri.

programme.title: Galeon 480 FLY – New generation nautical luxury
programme.desc: The new Galeon 480 FLY, designed by Tony Castro, offers expanded spaces and natural light thanks to oversized windows. Flybridge with double relaxation area, wet bar and top helm station, Beach Mode with glass balconies and aft platform with retractable grill.

programme.title: Tankoa Kinda - 50 meters of pure luxury
programme.desc: Come and discover Kinda, an incredible 50m superyacht, built by Tankoa and designed by Francesco Paszkowski.

programme.title: Aquila 50 Yacht FLIBS 2024
programme.desc: Bill Hackett is at the Fort Lauderdale Boat Show, aboard the Aquila 50 Yacht, a catamaran designed for long and sophisticated cruises, with an "Explorer" look. Refined interiors and panoramic windows offer exceptional views.

programme.title: Sunseeker Predator 75 - Performance and luxury in a sporty key
programme.desc: The Sunseeker Predator 75 combines power and stability with surprising interior livability and high-end design. Customizable cabins, extra-large garage, premium materials and technical innovations make it a sports yacht designed for long cruises in pure comfort.

programme.title: Super 7 Overview
programme.desc: Follow along with this introduction to the Super 7 components of the fitness program.

programme.title: Bode Core Balance
programme.desc: Improve your balance & core strength. Build a rock solid foundation with Bode Miller.

programme.title: Ultimate Glutes
programme.desc: Take your gluteus medius to its maximus with this butt-burning workout.

programme.title: Putting
programme.desc: Learn how to putt for dough with Darrell Kestner

programme.title: Baker Flight
programme.desc: In Episode three Baker Flight recurits get to spend time in the sky as they begin hands-on training in a Tiger Moth. After the flights, the recruits are ordered to prepare their barracks for a surprise VIP inspection.

programme.title: One Water Race 2025
programme.desc: One Water Race 2025 is a 60-hour, 250 km ultra-endurance challenge across the Stockholm Archipelago.

programme.title: Over the Horizon

programme.title: Over the Horizon

programme.title: Over the Horizon

programme.desc: Chef Khanh Ong embarks through Central Gippsland Victoria also known as The Middle of Everywhere.

programme.desc: Join The Full Nerd gang as they talk about the latest PC hardware topics.

programme.title: Kohler CES 2021 Smart Home Tour
programme.desc: Kohler takes us on a virtual tour of smart home kitchen and bath products, including the decadent Infinity Experience soaking tub.

programme.title: We teardown Cooler Master's MB311L, a micro-ATX case with ARGB
programme.desc: We first saw this case at CES, where it won our hearts—and find that we still like it quite a bit upon opening it up.

programme.title: Azza Pyramid Mini 806 teardown
programme.desc: Alaina takes us through the ins and outs of the Azza Pyramid Mini 806, a smaller ITX version of a uniquely shaped case.

programme.title: New Apple Watch Series 6, Apple Watch SE, and iPad Air announced
programme.desc: At the September 15th ‘Time Flies’ event Apple announced the Apple Watch Series 6, Apple Watch SE, the updated iPad Air and much more. This video features the top announcements from the event, with footage used from Apple.com. Check out more information about these products and more at www.apple.com and www.macworld.com.

programme.title: Amazon Echo Show 10 (3rd Gen) unboxing & setup
programme.desc: The third-generation Amazon Echo Show 10 isn’t just Amazon’s best smart display, it’s the most innovative, the most sophisticated, and the best-sounding smart home hub ever. In this video Adam unboxes the device, talks about the specs, and walks through the set up process for the Amazon Echo Show 10 (3nd Gen).

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 4
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: I Witness Medical Interns Episode 5
programme.desc: Still, young idealistic kids, with images of "GREY’S ANATOMY" floating in their heads are becoming doctors. The question is Why? The video journalists of "I Witness" live, eat and breathe alongside a group of residents at a large New Orleans hospital.

programme.title: Vegetation fire with Engine 5
programme.desc: Engine 5, with Mike Alvarez behind the wheel, arrives at Pizza Joint where other engine companies are on-scene of what could be an electric fire. The Captain explains the call. Another call comes in, its a vegetation fire, Engine 5 responds. They arrive on-scene of a huge vegetation fire along the freeway. Engine 9 takes the top road. The Department of Forestry rigs are on there way to a fire and they stop to help, but have to hit the road before the fire gets under control. Zippy, the Driver/Engineer on Engine 5 finds out he has made Captain, the B.C. drops by for congradulations. Mike on Engine 5 takes control of the Deck Gun and plummets water across the side of the hill. It takes a few hours to get it wet enough to declare in it safe. Late night, a call comes in, its a structure fire, when Engine 5 arrives they are assigned to "Salvage". In Fresno, the firefighters take care of the homeowners property as if it were their own. They want to make sure that if there is anything to hand over to the family that it will be good shape.

programme.title: Doctor's Diaries Episode 12
programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.desc: DOCTORS’ DIARIES is a dramatic reality series that delves deep into the lives of the people who save lives in the trauma center and emergency room in a large urban hospital.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 4
programme.desc: Amazing POV footage as if you were in the cockpit flying the jet yourself. A pure rush of adrenaline.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 5
programme.desc: Watch the amazing display of force and grace as these aircraft take off, fly high, and work to defend our freedom.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 6
programme.desc: The US Military flexes its might with some of the strongest, most adaptable ground vehicles in the world. Serve and protect.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 7
programme.desc: Tanks and other wheeled beasts grind across every terrain imaginable during training exercises and while deployed in actual combat. Their versatility is undeniable as they hurtle across sand and snow with equal efficiency

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 8
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part exploration of the militarys mobile cities. Aircraft carriers function like massive well-oiled machines that expand the reach of the armed services.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 9
programme.desc: Part two of a two-part episode on aircraft carriers that shows the sailors and pilots performing the seemingly miraculous task of catching a jet moving at 150 mph on a ships deck thats only 300 ft. long.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 10
programme.desc: The most prolific large ship in the fleet, destroyers were originally built to protect larger ships, but their ability to take on anything that comes their way, from air or sea, makes them formidable opponents in their own right.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 11
programme.desc: The second-largest ships in the fleet, after aircraft carriers, cruisers function as mobile missile platforms, always on the lookout for enemy aircraft or incoming missiles.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 12
programme.desc: Stand on the deck and crouch through the holds of the vessels that have inspired countless movies. From the modern computer stations to the apparently timeless engine rooms, real-life submarines have just as many stories to tell.

programme.title: Sword & Shield, Episode 13
programme.desc: Exciting footage of submarines ripping through the waves and breaking through thick sheets of ice. Anywhere, in any season, the sailors operating these stealthy ships are always prepared for action.

programme.title: UFA 324-325 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 6
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 6 part 1 Gulo v Spain. Muay Thai specialist Keenan Lewis takes on kickboxer Mike Hansen in the bantamweight division. A.J. Bryant (trained by Josh Barnett) faces Steven New (trained by Joe Stevenson) and In the main event, Serob "Gulo" Minasyan faces Charon Spain, a Strikeforce veteran. United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 6 part 2 Huang vs. Jimenez. In a lightweight bout Diego Perez faces Chase Peel. Jake Babian gets in the cage with Blair Sannoh in a middleweight bout and in the main event rising star Brady Huang (12-4) battles Anthony Jimenez.

programme.title: UFA 344 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 8 - Wassmer vs. Lua
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 8 from Southern California. In this episode, Kester Abad faces Dylan Stockard in a flyweight bout and Daniel Labastida and Matheus Santos face off in a bantamweight contest. Also watch as David Babakhanyan takes on Daniel Gualajara and in the main event, Elwig Wassmer, defending title holder and a biochemist looks to take on Israel Lua (Ben Jones camp) with knockout power, in whats expected to be a combustible fight with two titles on the line. The fighters contend for both the UNF flyweight title and the California state championship title.

programme.title: "UFA 331-332,339 - Up Next Fighting (UNF) 7"
programme.desc: United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 7 part 1 Gibson vs. Bayasgalan. In this episode Garrett Williams and Adam Garcia duke it out in a Lightweight bout. Bryen Dao faces Anthony Romero and in the main event, Chase Gibson takes on Ganbat Bayasgalan. United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 7 part 2 Gulo vs Taco. Jairee Emon Baker faces Kameron Fardad with a lightweight title on the line, Dion Young faces Alessandri Ridruguez and Christopher "Taco" Padilla faces Serob Minasyan in the main event. United Fight Alliance presents Up Next Fighting 7, Part 3 - Segura vs. Brock. Watch as Khaleel Pearson takes on Jonathan Winland, William Elliott faces Steve Mora in a bantamweight bout and knockout specialists Devon Brock and Mike Segura put there skills to the test in a lightweight match.

programme.title: The Mystical town of San Sebastian del Oeste, Mexio
programme.desc: Teri travels to San Sebastian del Oeste, an hour outside of Puerto Vallarta to experience the old mining town covered with pine, coffee and avocado trees. Here she learns the origin of the avocado, called aguacate (in Spanish) that was taken from the Nahuatl word of Āhuacatl (native Aztec language) which means "testicle tree".

programme.title: European Barge Cruises and the Tour de France!
programme.desc: Barge cruises have gained popularity in recent years with sophisticated travelers who want an unforgettable European getaway with deluxe accommodations and top-of-the line luxury.

programme.title: "Veganity": World's largest vegan restaurant opened in Dubai
programme.desc: There is an undeniable trend towards a plant-based diet. In the UK, the number of vegans reportedly quadrupled between 2014 and 2018. Even fast-food giants are now offering vegan alternatives to meat. And here in Dubai, a restaurant billed as the worlds largest vegan restaurant (‘Veganity’) has just opened its doors. Veganity’s founder Sky Sommer’s business was borne of her desire to show people that having a plant-based diet does not have to be a sacrifice. With over 200 dishes on the menu, everything from soul food to gourmet food are on offer. Sommer’s favourite dish is Molokhia; a recipe which has its roots in Ancient Egypt. “Its actually the name of a leaf; a greeny leaf that looks like spinach. So you just put olive oil, onions and garlic and coriander. This is what gives it that kick. Tomato paste, white vinegar, vegetable stock. Once you add the molokhia and the tomato paste you just let it boil to render down a bit. It becomes a bit thick and then you just get a hand blender.” Below weve provided a delicious Vegan recipe for you to try at home. Recipe Laham Ajeen Chop tomatoes x4 Diced onions x2 Garlic diced x8 Parsley chopped x1 bunch Red capsicum small squares x1 Green capsicum small squares x1 Minced meat (TVP) 250g Cook all together with 3-4 tablespoons of olive oil for around 10 minutes then add the spices below until they are well combined: Paprika x 4 tablespoons 7 spices x 4 tablespoons Garlic powder x 2 tablespoons Vegan Worcester sauce x 1 tablespoons Tomato paste x 4 tablespoons Vegetable stock x 1 cup Leave to marinate for up to 1 hour stirring it every 15 min till all liquids have dissolved then serve with half a lemon slice. The dough 5 cups of flour of choice 2 cups water Pinch of salt Sieve the flour into a bowl Add the salt Slowly add the water bit by bit while mixing the dough, cover and let rest for 30 minutes in a cool place then roll out to a clean surface and need for 5 min. Then cut the dough into 3 inch balls and roll the do

programme.title: Redbird
programme.desc: If youve ever wanted to eat a standout meal from a veteran chef on the grounds of an old Baroque-style cathedral—and who hasnt?—Redbird can offer you that unique experience. The acclaimed restaurant is attached to the historic St. Vibiana cathedral downtown. Youve probably seen chef Neal Fraser on TV, whether it was cooking on Top Chef Masters or beating Bobby Flay in a fried chicken sandwich Throwdown, but hes also been one of LAs more influential chefs over his tenured career. Brunching in the spectacular glass-enclosed atrium courtyard is always a great idea, where you can munch on BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PANCAKES or more refined dishes like a FOIE GRAS TORCHON with strawberry and pink peppercorn. Dont miss happy hour either. CHICKEN-FRIED SWEETBREADS paired with a $7 gin cocktail is a hard offer to pass up.

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.desc: From the simple perfection of summer boating, to the daily eruption of energy that is Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong has you covered an all things food, drink, entertainment, and lifestyle. The enchanting neighborhoods are coiled with history and culture, each with its own timeline of stories that speak persuasively about Hong Kong’s modernization. Situated against the backdrop of its secret cove-like harbor, the architecture that graces the land is just as extreme. Hong Kong sits atop the throne as the city with the most skyscrapers in the world, yet the urbanized areas are only a fraction of the city itself. The nature that surrounds and pushes through the city, gives Hong Kong it’s true indescribable magic. Denizens know where to find the hiking trails, the views, and escape routes to the open sea. The endless culinary delights, bold experiences, and hidden treasures make Hong Kong a torchbearer of culture, innovation, and lifestyle in Asia.

programme.title: Dubai Creek: Discover a lost Arabian world
programme.desc: Dubai Creek flows through the Emirates historic heart. For just one dirham, abra rides provide boatloads of nostalgia while travelling between the souks and museums of Deira and Bur Dubai. These heritage hubs recall the Bedouins’ humble and ancient past built on pearls, and then shaped by a free trade boom that brought new settlers to the creek in the early 1900’s. Echoing that era, today’s expats – some descendants of those early traders – share authentic flavours from their homelands in a culinary kaleidoscope that compliments Emirati fare. Popular food tours Food tours are a popular way to explore Dubai Creek. Arva Ahmed is the founder of Frying Pan Adventures. She describes one of the restaurants that features on the tours itinerary. "One of the restaurants we stop on our tour is called Sultan Dubai Falafel," she says. "And the thing that they are known for is stuffed falafels. They stuff them with chilli, onion and sumac. These falafels are the most juiciest most filled with herbs and fragrant falafels that you’re going to find in the city." Deira’s Waterfront market is piled high with technicolour fruit and vegetables and stacks of shellfish with legs choreographed in chorus-line unison. Here you can buy the catch of the day and have it cooked in many different ways for old-school Creekside dining. Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary Until recently, the creek ended at Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary. Here nature lovers can spot flamingos that migrate to the Sanctuary, a wetland extension of the creek spread over 6.2 sq.km. It features a variety of mangroves and lagoons perfect for migrating birds - the sanctuary is home to over 180 species of birds. Following its expansion as Dubai Canal, the creek curves past book-shaped Mohammed Bin Rashid Library, high-rise Business Bay and beach-hugging Jumeirah before it’s reunited with its source - the glittering Arabian Gulf.

programme.title: The biodiversity of Dubai's shores has brought fly fishing to the Middle East for the first time
programme.desc: When most people think of fly fishing they think of being far out in the wilderness, away from civilisation, by a river or somewhere in the ocean. But Ocean Active Fly has re-imagined this scene - offering urban fly fishing right in the middle of Dubai. This is the first fly fishing operation in the Middle East. The founder, Nick Bowles, explained to Euronews why fishing there are fishing opportunities in Dubai: "Dubai’s built the biggest man-made reefs with the palm islands and that, so it’s created a huge habitat." Artificial reefs can lead to a quick increase in the local fish population. They draw plankton which smaller fish can prey on which then attracts bigger fish suitable for fly fishing. One species drawn to the artificial reefs in Dubai is the queenfish. They can grow to be over a metre long and up to 15 kilograms, although most are about half that weight. This kind of fish is particularly good for fly fishing because of its visual takes and the fact it swims in schools. Fly fishing differs from more conventional spin fishing. Instead of having a heavy lure at the end of the fishing line, fly fishers have a fly which is lighter and less likely to scare away game. The fly stays on the surface of the water where fish will be attracted to it, thinking it is prey. With ocean fly fishing youre constantly on the move to find the next school of fish "So you literally run - shoot, run - shoot." But the unique part of fly fishing in Dubai is the proximity to its skyline. Fly fishing is done close to the shore so anglers are surrounded by the citys landmarks.: the Burj Khalifa, the Burj Al Arab, Palm Jumeirah and Dubai Marina.

programme.title: Namie Osawa
programme.desc: You had me at, "Futuristic robots and sexy Japanese babes fighting off monsters!"We sat down with Namie Osawa, owner and founder of the world famous Robot Restaurant and her team. Namie’s futuristic robot-inspired venue is as visually stimulating as it is entertaining and interactive. She walks us through her inspiration for what now has become a staple experience for locals and global travellers.Interview: NAMIE OSAWA I opened Robot Restaurant three years ago. Even though I was hesitant to show the first concept to foreigners and so forth, I decided to open the restaurant in Kabukicho with the Japanese Businessman in mind. When thinking about what would be appealing to a businessman, I thought about Robots - which I longed for as a kid,..and Girls in sexy costumes. These were the things that initially came to mind. Our rehearsals begin at 11 o’clock in the morning including Wadaiko, which is a Japanese drum dance. We practice for about an hour and thirty minutes, then we have a brief meeting before the show. Rehearsals can be tough, but whatever we go over, ..it’s amazing and we have fun and I think it’s very good. Still, I think that there is a part where not a lot of the content catches on with the audience. Even after repeated viewings, I would like to think that each show was better than the one before it. But on the name alone, people were intrigued and when it arrived, it was beyond the imagination because I wanted it to be a thoughtful experience. Always keep going forward, it’s what we want out of this show. I want to make sure there’s more to it than just a name.

programme.title: Toh A
programme.desc: In the wave of casual fine dining sweeping Asia, Toh A offers French-Taiwanese fusion that packs a nice punch. In addition to the set menu of excellence, the next most intriguing part of the restaurant is surely its interior design. Built during the Japanese colonial period, the building is over a hundred years old and was even used as a previous dormitory for the National Taiwan University. The original wooden rooftop still remains within the walled gates that open up to modern , Asian interior design that immediately make the outside world melt away. With a rotational set menu, Toh A offers a culinary experience that presents traditional Taiwanese cuisine with a modern French twist unlike any other establishment in Taipei today.

programme.title: Tulum
programme.desc: At its core Tulum is a vibrant mix of extremely old and extremely new. Prehistoric natural wonders and ancient Mayan ruins are scattered among world-class resorts slinging more fresh lobster and mezcal than the human body is probably meant to consume. Long known for its yoga retreats and rustic eco-hotels, the off-the-grid Tulum of 15 years ago is still there, but it now exists alongside thrumming nightlife and unparalleled culinary adventures. Chefs and mixologists from around the globe have been lured to Tulum by its beachside DGAF vibe and a willingness to rewrite the rules. There are plenty of destination-worthy bars and clubs near the city’s central Hotel Zone, but if you want to escape the glitz—or maybe civilization itself—plunge into one of the region’s underground swimming caves formed millions of years ago, believed by Mayans to be a passage to another dimension. With breathtaking beaches, history you can touch, and a unique kind of artistic-inspired luxury, Tulum is whatever you want it to be. Oh, and there are lots of tequila and tacos, too. Do take advantage of that.

programme.title: La Mer, Dubai’s newest beachfront neighbourhood, offers hip restaurants, water sports and fun parks
programme.desc: With the construction of Dubai’s latest luxury residential development, Port de La Mer by Meraas , and new hotel, Rove La Mer , La Mer is a of rising interest in today’s property market. La Mer, open since 2017, is one of Dubai’s most colourful seaside neighbourhoods, nestled on the northern shoreline. Divided into two areas, La Mer South and La Mer North, it’s defined by its retro Californian style. The Instagram-friendly destination offers a heady mix of water sports, fun parks, fashionable restaurants, street art and seasonal parties after dark. By day, visitors can hire sunbeds or rent wooden day rooms on La Mer Beach. The multi-coloured beach huts house showers. La Mer beach club, Train , is fully licensed with a shisha area, but its name is derived from its fitness facilities – it has a gym and a boxing and yoga studio – and its Origin 33 restaurant and lounge also serves healthy meals and a menu of fresh juices and smoothies. The best restaurants in La Mer, according to local award-givers, include Masti , a beachfront eatery applauded for its modern Indian cuisine, innovative mixology and eclectic interior design by Studio Lotus. The name Masti is derived from the Hindi word for fun and mischief and the décor and dishes live up to the name, with cheeky monkey artwork and playful fusions for the palate such as the tandoori chicken bao. Another creative culinary outlet is iScream . Managing Partner Rami Halawi came up with the concept for iScream with his family. Offering a wide selection of unusual flavours is the brand’s unique selling point. “Here at iScream, we’re very crazy; thats why we have crazy flavours like curry, kulfi, tabbouleh, ketchup and Mexican chilli-chocolate,” says Rami. On certain days, customers are invited to scream into a sound monitor for their ice cream – if they beat the highest recording in decibels, they win their ice cream for free. La Mer’s shops focus on beach pursuits and accessories, making it a good place to shop for swimwear, sunglasses, suntan lotion

programme.title: Taste Dubai: An Emirati Iftar
programme.desc: During Ramadan, practising Muslims abstain from eating and drinking during daylight hours. The meal that follows is known as Iftar, and you do not have to be Muslim to partake in one. In this edition of Taste, Euronews visited the Jumeirah Zabeel Saray Hotel in Dubai, to sample the special Iftar menu produced by the worlds first Emirati chef. After Athan, the call for evening prayer, Muslims who have been fasting all day can finally eat and drink. The fast is broken by first eating dates. This is of great religious significance, chef Musabbeh Al Kaabi explained. "Prophet Mohammed used to do this when he was breaking his fast, so we always break it with the dates then laban (a fermented milk drink) or water," he said. Chef Musabbeh first served up a traditional dish - king rice. Its name comes from its historically prestigious status as an expensive dish only eaten by royalty or the rich. "Liver is there, beef is there, saffron rice is there. So it’s all luxury things. I have cooked saffron rice, I have fried cauliflower, boiled chickpeas. Now I need to take the flavour of the onions with all these things," Chef Musabbeh said as he prepared the dish. "I will put the rice in now. I’ll put some spices in as well. So now, I’m going to put it on a plate, and I’m going to garnish it" But, before eating, everyone said Bismillā, which means in the name of Allah. Chef Musabbeh then prepared his second dish the famous Emirati ouzi with oriental rice, a lamb dish with cinnamon and cardamom. You can make the dish yourself by following the recipe below: Chef Musabbehs Ouzi and Oriental Rice Recipe Ingredients: 1100g lamb shank 500g of basmati rice 100g of minced lamb 2 bay leaves 3 cinnamon sticks 10g of garlic - freshly chopped 120g of onion - freshly chopped 100g of tomato - freshly chopped 20g of ghee butter Salt and pepper 6.5ml of water 10g of tamarind powder 40g of Emirati spices 30g of tomato paste 40g of coriander - freshly chopped Instructions: 1. Chop the onions, garli

programme.title: Visiting Dubai's many museums
programme.desc: Dubai is home to a multitude of museums, from world-firsts to hidden gems. Quranic Park is one of the citys brand new attractions. About the size of 60 rugby fields, it has been created to give visitors some green space and a better understanding of Islamic beliefs. Inside the park’s orchards and Glass House, visitors can discover a variety of healthy and medicinal flora featured in the Holy Quran, from pomegranates and olives, to figs and garlic. Another attraction at Quranic Park is the Cave of Miracles, where seven miracles recounted in the Holy Quran play out on the walls. "The cave was amazing," says Usman, who is visiting from the UK. "We learnt a lot about the miracles growing up, it just gave another understanding to it. And it was great to visualise it, not just hear about it." "This is an open example that the Quran is not just to read in order to get reward but it is something that can be in practical life," says Anwar, a visitor from the US. "This place is beautiful and a very interesting experience for children. Here, they can actually experience things from the Quran," says Miteab, who lives in Saudi Arabia. Al Shindagha Perfume House From aromatic flora to the UAE’s first museum dedicated to fragrance. The Al Shindagha museum is home to the Perfume House . Part of a complex created to gather, preserve and share Emirati heritage, Perfume House charts the history and role of fragrance in the region. Rashed Almuhairi is Perfume House’s Chief Cultural Guide. “It’s special and important not only for the guests who are coming, he tells Euronews. "It’s for our own generations also. A lot of our youth, they didn’t live in many things like perfuming or pearl diving, so it’s important that they know about our past life. Dubai has a very rich history which needs to be told.” One of the more unusual exhibits on display is a 28 kilogramme piece of oud. Oud is formed in aquilaria trees when they are infected with a particular type of mould. This resinous heartwood is the key ingr

programme.title: Kanda Myojin
programme.desc: Located in Chiyoda, this Shinto shrine has been watching over the neighborhoods of Kanda, Nihonbashi, Akihabara, Ootemachi, Marunouchi and others since the 14th century. Although the Gate of God suffered the fires, earthquakes and wars over the years, the rebuilt pavilion — decked out in stunning vermillion and gold with lacquered interiors — still attracts worshipers and visitors alike. Like the Kanda area itself, the shrine celebrates its history but also looks to the future. On any given day, you’ll find a mix of businessmen praying to the gods for luck and prosperity, young brides wishing for a good marriage, and others simply trying to ward of bad vibes. But the shrine’s priests started reaching out to younger generations with anime characters and charms that look like SD cards. Every other May, the shrine becomes a centerpiece for Kanda Matsuri, one of Tokyo’s most famous festivals since the Edo period. Locals parade with their favorite deities, or kami, through the neighborhoods, making their way to the shrine for the ultimate bash. If you think you have a samurai spirit, this should feel like home.

programme.title: Why visitors are hooked on Dubai Marina, home to luxury yachts, docks, hotels and beach clubs
programme.desc: Whether you see it from the deck of a boat or the wire of its 1km zipline, Dubai Marina is a spectacle of ground-breaking architecture, bespoke superyachts and luxury shoreline hospitality. This sought-after holiday destination encompasses the coastal neighbourhood of Jumeirah Beach Residence, known locally as JBR, home to retail and entertainment developments The Walk and The Beach, which multiple the attractions for fun-seekers. Iconic five-star hotels hug the shoreline, their vast marble lobbies leading to some of Dubai’s most famous weekend brunches and postcard-perfect beaches. Le Méridien Mina Seyahi Beach Resort & Marina is one of the longest-standing hotels in Dubai Marina with 500 metres of private Arabian Gulf coastline providing a playground for water sports enthusiasts. Local expats regularly fill the resort’s Barasti bar, restaurant and beach club. A Dubai institution in its second decade, this well-liked venue has grown into a sprawling sports and beach bar with open-air screenings and food stalls, and the only free-entry beach club in town. Despite progression, Barasti retains its original theme, defined by palm fronds typically found in the traditional barasti shelters favoured by the early Bedouins. Other Dubai Marina beach clubs that draw crowds include Drift to Zero Gravity . Drift is dizzyingly beautiful; its pool deck, a catwalk for the latest swimwear fashions. Open until late, Zero Gravity is known for its high-octane parties and voyeuristic glass-sided pool. Sun worshippers on Dubai Marina’s deep sandy beaches pose for photos that frame its remarkable urban skyline. It’s a backdrop that’s hard to miss, containing some of the tallest residential towers in the world. The 101-storey Princess Tower once claimed the title of the highest, while the Cayan Tower retains its record for the world’s tallest building with a 90-degree twist; it’s structure akin to a giant corkscrew. Flying through the skyscrapers on XLine Dubai is an exhilarating way to experience this brave a

programme.title: Discover the supersized attractions of Downtown Dubai, starting with the world’s tallest building
programme.desc: Downtown Dubai’s ample attractions include a 10-million litre aquarium, an Olympic-sized ice rink and the world’s tallest building. Nothing can prepare visitors for the true scale of record-breaking Burj Khalifa . At twice the height of the Empire State Building and almost three times the size of the Eiffel Tower, it soars 828 metres into the sky. Inside, there are 160 floors occupied by designer Giorgio Armani’s first-ever hotel , award-winning restaurants, luxury apartments and offices – and observation decks at levels 124, 125 and 148. Colourful wings, painted on observation deck windows, are designed for guests to pose between them. Part of the Global Angel Wings Project by Colette Miller, before appearing in Dubai, they were seen in Australia, China, Cuba, Europe, Kenya, Japan and the United States. The wings hint that humans can be angels of the earth and serve as a reminder to do good. Next door, The Dubai Mall houses more of Downtown Dubai’s supersized attractions. Visitors can cage-dive with sharks at the vast Dubai Aquarium and Underwater Zoo and Dubai Mall’s indoor ice rink is an ample fit for professional figure skaters at 60 metres long; it can also snow here at the flick of a switch. While some attractions defy reality, others escape it altogether. Dubbed ‘The Centre of Now’, Downtown Dubai can take visitors to the future at the world’s largest VR Park in The Dubai Mall, a hive of virtual and augmented realities. Dubai in 2050 is the setting of indoor park’s augmented reality rollercoaster, made all the more exhilarating with headsets that place passengers in the cockpit of a computer-generated helicopter. As the virtual helicopter orbits out of the control, the very real, very fast rollercoaster cars plummet through loops and spin on their axes. Bustling with entertainment, Downtown Dubai’s high-octane epicentre is looped by the laidback, café-lined Sheikh Mohammad bin Rashid Boulevard – a starting point for a public art trail. Downtown Dubai is an urban canvas of sculptures

programme.title: Dubai: Discover the jewels in the crown of the city's civilisation
programme.desc: When people think of Dubai it is often thought of as a new city. But, in fact, its history goes back more than 5,000 years. Archaeologists have unearthed a series of exciting and mysterious discoveries across the Emirate. These include the Jumeirah Archaeological site, which dates back to the Abbasid Period in the 10th century AD, to the Saruq Al Hadid site – a centre for human inhabitants and trade and metallurgy from the Umm Al Nar period (2600-2000 BCE) to the Iron Age. When the Jumeirah Archaeological site was discovered, experts noticed that the walls of the buildings there were plastered. Dr Mansour Boraik, an archaeology specialist from Dubai, said: "It was plastered inside and outside with white plaster. When they tried to picture the city during the Abbasid Period, and they imagined that it would look like a white city from the shores of the Gulf." The site shows Dubai during the Abbasid period which is around the 10th century AD. The geographical location of the site is important. It sits on the shoreline of Dubai but also on the major trade route between Mesopotamia, India and Oman. It also sits in-between the Arabic and Indian peninsular. The 80,000 square metre site sits in the shadow of the Burj Khalifa and the imposing Dubai skyline, emphasising the comparison between old and new worlds. The circular and semi-circular tower supports reflect the prosperity of the inhabitants of the time who will have been a mixture of locals and passing tradesmen. A variety of silver coins, pottery, copper, glass and stone artefacts have been excavated. Its one of the largest and most important Islamic sites ever discovered in the Gulf. It is also home to the oldest Mosque discovered in the UAE. Saruq al Hadid Saruq al Hadid is regarded as the jewel in the crown of archaeological discoveries In Dubai. This ancient industrial metallurgical centre dates back to the Iron Age and indicates that Dubai was a global trading hub. Ahmed Mahmoud, Director of Architectural Heritage Department in Dubai, said

programme.title: Panoramic Paramotoring
programme.desc: It consists of a tricycle, an engine powering a propeller that fills a canopy and - thankfully- a back-up canopy. One of the smallest aircraft in the world, Paramotors are the latest way to take to the skies above Dubais sand dunes. And as its wing rises, so does Euronews James OHagans nerves: "My pilot Jos assures me he’s never needed it ( the backup wing)." The morning mist clears and Jos Vandenbroucke, General manager pf Paramotor Desert Adventure, has given the word to go ahead. "Ready for rock and roll? he says. "We’re like 40/50 metres. No more. We can easily go up to 12,000 feet. In case we have an engine failure, it’s just doing this (Jos turns off engine)." Paramotors are one of the smallest aircraft in the world and have a great safety record because the engine is only needed for gaining altitude and can be switched off when you come back down to land. "We will do a spiral. If you can’t hold it anymore James, you just shout." "Now we do a 360 to the right. Yalla, here we go!" "The G-force in your stomach is class!" says OHagan. Flying over a stretch of desert reserve, you can see an array of wildlife; families of camels, Arabian oryx and even a tower of giraffes. "After that, I think I can safely say that I’ve got over my fear of flying and kiss the ground," says OHagan.

programme.title: Mother's Day Gift Guide: Travel Gifts
programme.desc: Mother’s Day is just around the corner, so weve rounded up a few excellent gifts shell love. From fab fashion to beautiful art, join us as we reveal some of our favorite things.

programme.title: Judy Joo's Ethnic Bites in London
programme.desc: Iron Chef Judy Joo shares her cant-miss list of ethnic dining in London. From dim sum in Soho to sushi in Marylebone, find the best here.

programme.title: Flying on water - James O'Hagan tries out the latest addition to the surfing family
programme.desc: It looks like a surfboard, it moves like a surfboard, but its not a surfboard. Its an electric hydrofoil or E-foil. I visited Dubai Marine to have a go at E-foiling myself and find out what makes the activity so thrilling. The man putting me through my paces was Daniel van Dooren, the manager of Ibiza Foils and co-founder of Surf House Dubai . "The thing that makes it different is this hydrofoil wing on the bottom," explained Daniel. "Its got an aeroplane design, which basically lifts you out of the water and gives you that sensation like you’re flying." The E-foils are powered by an electric propeller and controlled remotely via Bluetooth. They can reach speeds of up to 45km an hour. Find out how I got on with my first experience on an E-foil by watching the video above this article. Heres a clue: I wont be giving up my day job anytime soon.

programme.title: Seoul
programme.desc: South Korea has been making waves on a global scale. Across Asia and the rest of the world, this capital city is a pulsating force in pop-culture and beauty. Like its denizens - well-dressed, confident, and proud - this influential city pushes the new frontiers while honoring its 2,000 year old heritage. Emerging as one of Asia’s tastemaker-cultures, Seoul births new trends in foods, fashion, beauty, technology, and entertainment. From 24hr shopping in Dongdaemun, hanging in HongDae, strolling down Garosugil, or drowning yourself in the different party scenes that define Itaewon and Gangnam’s nightlife, Seoul is trendy, vibrant, and engaging. While each neighborhood has its own distinction, Seoul pours out its love generously to all of its residents and visitors with each sip of soju or bite of kimchi. Whether you come for the food, the people, or the party, trust us, you’ll feel like you’re the underdog as the city test your limits. We love Seoul.

programme.title: Taipei
programme.desc: Being underestimated, is one of the biggest advantages. Maybe that’s what makes Taipei a unique city and one of Asia’s best kept secrets when it comes to food, fun, and all things lifestyle. Often under-reported and overlooked, Taiwan’s global impact for such a small island is breathtaking. When it comes to Taiwan and food, experts and enthusiasts alike know that they go hand-in-hand. It is no wonder Taipei is overflowing with electricity as new ideas and re-imagined classics are popping up all over town. This magical friction is a big reason Taipei’s food scene is attracting young talent from the world’s best kitchens looking to experiment, innovate, and test their ideas against the discerning palates of the local crowds. Highlighted by some of the world’s best produce, great transportation, magnificent hiking trails 5 minutes from downtown, a vibrant nightlife, and an openness towards travelers and new faces makes Taipei one of Black Buddha’s favorite cities.

programme.title: An Intimate Conversation on the State of Black America with Marc Morial
programme.desc: Marc Morial, President &CEO of the National Urban League, has redefined civil rights for the 21st Century. In an exclusive conversation with Black Enterprise CEO Earl “Butch” Graves. He shares his views on the findings of the organization’s annual report on racial inequality on black health and wealth as well as his outlook on the upcoming presidential election.

programme.title: Ann-Marie Campbell Builds Her Career at The Home Depot
programme.desc: We profile Ann-Marie Campbell, the executive vice president of U.S. Store operations for the world’s largest Home Improvement retailers, The Home Depot. She opens up her tool kit with secrets to longevity in corporate America. Then, Star Jones, president of the Professional Diversity Network, expresses her views on an issue vital to multi-cultural women around the world. See how she’s helping more women gain access to the C-suite. Jackie Glenn, vice president of global diversity at Dell EMC, advocates for bringing diversity into the workforce. And finally, we feature Rose Stuckley Kirk, Verizon Foundation president, who’s giving underserved students the tools needed to succeed in technology.

programme.title: Building Your Practice Into a Big Business
programme.desc: “Everyone’s Favorite Closing Attorney” Tiffani Hawes has built The Hawes Law Firm into a multimillion-dollar legal practice

programme.title: Fantasia is Fantastic Back on Broadway
programme.desc: On this edition of Our World with Black Enterprise, we sit down with singer and actress Fantasia and she takes us on a soulful journey in the new musical, "After Midnight." She talks about her return to the stage and the challenges she had to overcome to get there. Plus, after 15 years since the first movie, director Malcolm Lee, and the cast of the new movie, "The Best Man Holiday" tells us about the sequel that people cant stop talking about. Cast members include Taye Diggs, Sanaa Lathan, Morris Chestnut, Nia Long, terrence Howard, Monica Calhoun, Regina Hall, Melissa De Sousa and Harold Perrineau. And finally, we profile a ballerina Misty Copeland, who is dancing her way into the hearts of millions.

programme.title: Get Outside It s Good for You
programme.desc: Leadership coach Nailah Blades shares how the outdoors can improve your well-being, bring you joy, and help you connect to your inner voice

programme.title: Joy Reid s Next Chapter
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist and bestselling author Joy Reid opens up about the launch of her new podcast, "The Joy Reid Show," just months after the abrupt cancellation of her primetime daily news show, "The ReidOut," on MSNBC. The political analyst also discusses the challenges of building her own media platform and why a growing wave of progressives are leaving the Democratic Party.

programme.title: The Resurgence of The Black Press
programme.desc: Along with the newspaper industry as a whole, the traditional Black press that served as harbingers of Black progress from before Reconstruction to the post-Civil Rights Era, has for many been missing and presumed dead. However, in the wake of COVID and the demands for change following George Floyd’s murder, the Black press has emerged with renewed relevance and a fresh commitment to partnership and innovation. Second-generation Black press owner Lawrence “Larry” Lee of the Observer Media Group joins Beyond The Hype to provide an inside look at the resurgence of traditional Black newspaper brands and why it matters for Black communities.

programme.title: Sequoia and Kings Canyon National Parks
programme.desc: This lush, cinematic journey immerses you in the majesty of Kings Canyon and Sequoia National Parks, where ancient Sequoia giants tower overhead, their massive trunks bathed in dappled light. Gentle rivers meander through verdant forests, leading to serene waterfalls whose soft cascades offer a soothing, meditative ambiance. The crisp, snowy high‑Sierra peaks in the distance add a stunning alpine contrast that evokes calm and wonder. Altogether, the film crafts a tranquil escape into natures beauty—perfect for relaxation, reflection, or simply drifting off into nature’s embrace. This 90 minute film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview for "Journey Along the Oregon Coast"
programme.desc: Experience spectacular coastal landscapes in "Journey Along the Oregon Coast". See dramatic sea stacks illuminated by colorful skies, pristine beaches, spring wildflowers, and even watch a Roosevelt elk gallop along Canon Beach! This relaxing and exhilarating film is accompanied by the soothing sounds of ocean waves and birdsongs. The full film is 85 minutes in length and available to subscribers of www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Preview for "Big Sur"
programme.desc: This is a preview for the 90 Minute Ambient Nature Film "Big Sur". Journey through Big Sur, a renowned stretch of the California Coast featuring amazing cliffs & sea stacks, beaches, wildflowers, redwood forests, sealife, and brilliant ocean waters. Spectacular cinematography is accompanied by a soothing soundtrack of music and ocean waves. To see the full film visit www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: NatureStream.tv Preview
programme.desc: NatureStream.tv provides a window to the worlds beauty through Nature Films, TV Art Displays, and Ambient Music.

programme.title: Preview of Summer on Mt. Rainier
programme.desc: This is a preview of "Summer on Mt. Rainier", available to stream at www.NatureStream.tv. Experience the beauty of lush wildflower blooms on Mount Rainier paired with a soothing soundtrack in this 50 minute video. 4k UHD Naturestream.TV videos turn your screens into a spectacular display of ambient art that inspires the spirit and soothes the soul.

programme.title: Preview of 5 Hour Crackling Fireplace
programme.desc: Enjoy a the sights and sounds of a glowing fire for 5 hours in Parts 1 and 2 of Crackling Fireplace in 4k - by NatureStream.tv. To get full access to visit www.NatureStream.tv and subscribe!

programme.title: Preview for Journey Through Alaska
programme.desc: Experience the magnificence of the Alaskan wilderness in "Journey Through Alaska". Fly over blue glaciers, see grizzly cubs cuddle with their mom, and witness alpenglow on Denali in this new release from NatureStream.tv. The full 90 minute film is available to subscribers of NatureStream.tv on August 22, 2023.

programme.title: Preview for "Tahoe From Above" Relaxing Nature Film
programme.desc: Soar over the worlds most scenic alpine lake in the 2 hour 45 minute "Tahoe From Above". Breathtaking aerial cinematography of Lake Tahoe is accompanied by an inspiring instrumental soundtrack. This is a 2 minute preview of the full film available at www.NatureStream.tv.

programme.title: Seasons of the Sierra - Ambient Nature Film
programme.desc: Experience the spectacular seasons of the Sierra Mountains in this 3 hour film. From vast swaths of colorful aspens to sparkling wildflower meadows, the "Seasons of the Sierra" showcases the stunning beauty of the Range of Light.

programme.title: Ariana Grande vs. Pete Davidson
programme.desc: S1:E11 What made Kanye West go to war against Pete Davidson? Kanye is relentlessly going after Pete, so much so, that Kim Kardashian is concerned about the safety of her new boyfriend. Is it because Kanye knows Pete’s history of controversial relationships? Our team got the real story behind the tabloids, the truth behind Pete’s behavior in relationships, and the journey he went on to truly start loving who he is.

programme.title: Kristen Stewart vs. Robert Pattinson
programme.desc: S1:E2 Every girl wanted to be Bella Swan in the blockbuster movie, Twilight. When Kristen Stewart auditioned and got the role, she fell in love with co-star Robert Pattinson shortly after, and the world became obsessed with the new young couple. But what Kristen didn’t expect was the endless media scrutiny, paparazzi following her entire life, and the endless craze from fans. After getting caught in a shocking scandal and being villainized by the entire world. But the media got her story wrongKristen had to embrace her authenticity to have the courage to be who she truly was regardless of what the world thought. We dug into Kristen and Roberts romance to find the real life story behind the tabloids.

programme.title: Katy Perry vs. Russell Brand
programme.desc: S1:E7 Katy Perry is no stranger to toxic relationships. She finally thought she landed the perfect one with bad boy comedian Russell Brand, only for him to divorce her through text message right in the middle of her world tour 2 years later. Our team uncovered the full story of the turbulent aftermath and the journey she went on to become a strong, authentic person who was finally able to fully embrace a healthy relationship.

programme.title: Jennifer Aniston vs. Brangelina
programme.desc: S1:E12 For almost 20 years, the media portrayed Jennifer Aniston as a heartbroken woman who would never be happy until she had kids. That couldn’t be further from the truth. Our team uncovered details that will prove Brad and Jennifer were the perfect Hollywood couple everybody adored, until Brad suddenly left Jen for Angelina Jolie. This story is so much bigger than Brangelina.

programme.title: Rihanna vs. Chris Brown.
programme.desc: S1:E1 Rihanna found herself the victim of assault, from her best friend and then-boyfriend, Chris Brown. Not only was she humiliated in front of the world, but she also faced further attacks from the media, some going as far as claiming the violence was her fault. We uncovered the real story of Rihanna’s experience during and after the incident, not the one portrayed by the media, where she shows us why she is the strong, compassionate, graceful woman the world fell in love within the first place.

programme.title: The Rise Of Damien Rider
programme.desc: S1:E7 Damien Rider was beaten up, thrown against walls, and left all by himself as a child because of an abusive stepfather. After four attempts to end his own life, he decided he needed to deal with his demons by doing the most extreme thing he could do. Discover why Damien felt like he needed to paddle through a deadly ocean and why when he was just about to quit, the entire trajectory of his life would be permanently changed forever.

programme.title: The Rise of Jonny Kim
programme.desc: S1:E3 From the outside, Jonny Kim looks like one of the most ambitious people you’ll ever hear about. A person who can become a Navy SEAL, a doctor and an astronaut all before the age of 40 must be a confident, talented person. However, Jonny didn’t grow up aspiring to be a highly trained soldier-doctor capable of going to outer space. It was only until he experienced one of the darkest, most traumatic things a child could go through, that he discovered a calling way bigger than himself.

programme.title: The Rise of Wim Hof
programme.desc: S1:E1 The Iceman (Wim Hof), a man seemingly immune to freezing temperatures, who once climbed Mount Everest only in his shorts and shoes sounds like a fictional superhero. But Wim isn’t invincible to pain, in fact, the opposite. The worst tragedy he’s suffered was the catalyst that inspired him to master his mind and body and help millions do the same.

programme.title: The Rise of Charity Witt
programme.desc: S1:E5 Dubbed The Worlds Strongest Barbie, Charity suffered a heart attack when she was only 17 years old, due to being overworked and poor life choices. This health crisis lead her to change her mindset by taking action on changing her life, that put her on a path that lead her to becoming an elite powerlifter, a Strongwoman competitor, a winner of the Titan Games and escaping an abusive relationship.

programme.title: Daryl Davis Did the Unthinkable
programme.desc: Daryl Davis was determined to understand why he was hated for the color of his skin. His pursuit for answers brought him face to face with the leader of the KKK. Find out how one conversation is changing history in real time.

programme.title: Ramla Ali Blow by Blow - A Life in the Ring
programme.desc: After her brother died in the Somali Civil War, Ramla Ali and her family fled to the UK in hopes of a better life. But things werent easy for the young Somali... Ramla stood out and was bullied because she was overweight and from a different culture. When her mother bought her a gym membership in order to build her confidence, Ramla tried out a boxing class and fell in love with the sport. A move that would change her life forever.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay Karma is Served
programme.desc: Blind chef, Christine Ha, shocked the nation when she tried out for the reality show cooking competition, Masterchef. Perhaps even more surprising was Gordon Ramsay’s scandalous reaction. She made him eat his words on national tv and made Masterchef history!

programme.title: The Dark Side of Elon Musk
programme.desc: Elon Musk, founder of SpaceX and CEO of Tesla, always found it hard fitting in with others. Hiding his painful secrets - Elon threw himself into his work, amassing huge success as an entrepreneur. But when he got caught up in the middle of a messy divorce with Amber Heard, Elon’s worst fears were realized and he hit a severe breaking point.

programme.title: Paul de Gelder Saved by Sharks
programme.desc: In 60 years, no one had been attacked by a shark in Sydney Harbour... Until one day, it happened to Navy diver Paul de Gelder! How did he survive? What drove him to fight for his life?

programme.title: Oprah Prison Of the Past
programme.desc: This one important person in Oprah Winfreys life wanted nothing to do with her until she was famous. Years later, Oprah is forced to confront her. Before you live a life of regret, listen to Oprah’s story

programme.title: Elizabeth Smart Trapped and Lost
programme.desc: Elizabeth Smart was carried off at 14 years old and was missing for 9 grueling months. Those were the worst months of her life, the details of which were so terrible, she refused to share her story for ten years… until something changed. This is her story of survival and strength.

programme.title: Simone Biles Surviving To Soar
programme.desc: Ultimate gymnastics champion Simone Biles was at the top of her sport and defying gravity at the Tokyo 2021 Olympics. Everyone expected her to win, but every athlete has a breaking point… The Team USA superstar finally opens up about her mental health, the strict pressures of the sports industry and the DISTURBING secret involving Dr. Larry Nassar that she hid for years. Find out what REALLY happened to Simone Biles.

programme.title: Pardeep Kaleka Empathy - The Path From Darkness to Light
programme.desc: This is the remarkable story of Pardeep Kaleka, a faithful Sikh believer, and his quest to track down his fathers killer. In his search for truth, he bonded with a former White Supremacist. What did they have in common? And how did their friendship transform lives around the world? Forgiveness is a powerful tool to heal ourselves, connect deeply, and truly make our world better. Who do you need to forgive today?

programme.title: Ramla Ali Blow by Blow - A Life in the Ring
programme.desc: After her brother died in the Somali Civil War, Ramla Ali and her family fled to the UK in hopes of a better life. But things werent easy for the young Somali... Ramla stood out and was bullied because she was overweight and from a different culture. When her mother bought her a gym membership in order to build her confidence, Ramla tried out a boxing class and fell in love with the sport. A move that would change her life forever.

programme.title: Real Stories With Jordan Peterson

programme.title: 5 Daily Habits of the Happiest Retirees

programme.title: Why Clients Choose Supplemental Plans or Medicare Advantage
programme.desc: Lets explore the reasons behind these preferences and the key differences between supplemental and Medicare Advantage plans.

programme.title: Why Are More Americans Feeling TRAPPED In Advantage Plans
programme.desc: In todays episode Marvin Musick from Medicare School puts special focus on Medicare Advantage Plans. He compares the three main Medicare choices: Original Medicare (Parts A and B), Medigap (supplemental insurance), and Medicare Advantage Plans. He underscores the financial vulnerabilities of relying solely on Original Medicare and the advantages of considering either Medigap or Medicare Advantage Plans to counter these risks. Marvin also addresses the critical concerns surrounding Medicare Advantage Plans. He highlights how these plans, while initially appealing due to their low upfront costs and additional services like dental care, can later reveal hidden limitations and unexpected expenses. This is a episode you WONT want to miss!

programme.title: Saschiz Old Town, Romania
programme.desc: Saschiz, village, and commune, Mureș județ county is located in central Romania. The villages of Saschiz, Mihai Viteazu, and Cloașterf make up the larger commune of Saschiz. Located in the old region of Transylvania, it lies about 20 km east of Sighișoara"&". First documented in the 14th century, Saschiz is known for its medieval fortress and church constructed by Transylvanian Saxons, a German speaker. They settled in Transylvania when it was part of Hungary. The ruins of the 14th-century fortress sit atop "&"a hill overlooking the village. The late 15th-century fortified church has Gothic details and an imposing clock tower. Along with five other villages with fortified churches, Saschiz was inscribed on UNESCO’s World Heritage sites in 1999.
